q: , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. Quotes delayed, except where indicated otherwise. Delay times are 15 mins

yet to finish his Ph.D. in computer science from Stanford University, transforming himself from computer scientist-cum-entrepreneur to a CEO role is a big shift. But Eric Schmidt believes Page is ready to take over by saying, We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. Eric Schmidt on his page also emphasized that`` Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!'' indicating that Page is ready to take the helm.
